stories.text:
When you use a CLI tool, do you feel you're saying "take this action" or "make this so"?

For example, if you ran a command like this:

$ resize 500G file

and file was already 500G, should the command return an error code? Or a success code?
stories.title: Ask HN: Running a command, are you saying “take this action” or “make this so”?
Complimenting a competitor can drive a firm's revenues

stories.text:
Why do you do it and why should anyone do it? How would you approach it?

Personally, I have a hobby project dealing with some programming issues I experience.

I simply want it to generate more debate around those issues and hopefully get some serious feedback regarding it ('have you tried X instead?' is not a very good feedback when every comment is like that, imo). However, it is proving to be a much harder quest than anticipated. It feels hard to do so without spamming.

So, what do you think about these topics? Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you promote your hobby projects? Why?

stories.text:
I'm working on a project in the real estate space, with possible SEC considerations as well. I've consulted with some startup attorneys and received a quote of 8-10k for organizational and basic legal costs - it actually seems reasonable for the amount of work. I can't just use legalzoom or stripe atlas for this one.

Can anyone here recommend accelerators that would be well-equipped to provide this sort of legal assistance?
stories.title: Ask HN: Recommendations on accelerators that provide legal assistance
The Quest to Shoot an Arrow Farther Than Anyone Has Before
What If Zink Was the Fastest GL Driver?
